name: Joseph Wang
title: Markets Weekly January 4, 2025
text:
Synopsis
The incoming Trump administration is likely to implement tariffs and potentially capital controls as a strategic approach to address chronic trade imbalances with China, viewing these measures as a way to boost US manufacturing and employment.

Key Insights
- Traditional economic theory of comparative advantage has failed to balance trade relationships between the US and China
- China uses industrial policies to maintain manufacturing advantages, including:
  - Currency manipulation
  - Subsidies to specific industries
  - Looser environmental and labor regulations
- Chronic trade imbalances have resulted in significant US job losses in manufacturing
- Proposed solutions include:
  - Implementing tariffs to make US manufacturing more competitive
  - Potential capital controls to redirect foreign dollar holdings
- The approach aims to restructure economic relationships by forcing more balanced trade
- Potential consequences include:
  - Higher prices for US consumers
  - Reduced competitiveness of Chinese export sectors
  - Potential disruption to US financial markets and capital flows
- The strategy reflects a departure from traditional free trade principles
